events.name: CSESoc Personal Projects Competition
events.description:
CSESoc is holding a personal projects competition to curb your holiday boredom! Either go solo or grab a few friends and team up to make a cool technical project together ğŸ˜

This is a great way for adding projects to your resume and building your technical skills as well as have the chance to win a share of the prize pool! ğŸŠâ€â™‚ï¸

Be sure to press GOING as we will be posting updates through the competition! âœ”

Not sure how to start building your project? Be sure to sign up for our Frontend and Backend workshops! ğŸ‘

Sign up: http://bit.ly/PersonalProjCompSignUp

Backend Workshop (12-2pm Tuesday, 1 September): 
https://bit.ly/CSEBackWorkshop

Frontend Workshop (2-4pm Wednesday, 9 September):
https://bit.ly/CSEFrontWorkshop

Rules:
- Teams must be between 1 to 3 (inclusive) UNSW students.
- Teams cannot submit a project from work or a university course - it must be original.
- Teams cannot submit a project made before this competition - it must be new.
- Projects must be open-source and deployed.

Submission:
SUBMISSIONS DUE 11:59PM FRIDAY, 18 SEPTEMBER
Please register INDIVIDUALLY here: https://bit.ly/PersonalProjectsComp
Teams that register will receive an email later to submit:
1. A link to a public repo on Github.
2. A link to the deployed project.

Prizes
First Prize - $200 
Second Prize - $150
First Year's Prize - $150 (all team members commenced as an Undergraduate student in 2020)
Postgraduate Prize - $150 (all team members must be enrolled as a Postgraduate student)
Hitchhiker's Prize - $42 (awarded by a popular vote)

Keep an eye out on our vote later to determine the winner of the Hitchhikerâ€™s Prize...

Judgement
Our judges have their own portfolio of personal projects! They will be announced later.
Projects will be judged on three criteria:
Usability (35%)
Technical (35%)
Deployment (15%)
Originality (15%)
The full judgement criteria is here:
http://bit.ly/CSESocProjectsCompCriteria


-------------- EVENT DETAILS --------------
When: Submit by 11:59pm Friday, 18 September
Where: Online
Who: Open to all UNSW students!

events.name: UNSW CSESoc Industry Mentoring Program 2020 Applications
events.description:
CSESoc is launching our flagship Industry Mentoring Program following its successful 2019 debut and we want you to join us! Apply now for the chance to meet mentors from:

ğŸ”¥ Amazon
ğŸ”¥ Canva 
ğŸ”¥ Quantium 
ğŸ”¥ Atlassian
ğŸ”¥ Deloitte 
ğŸ”¥ Accenture
ğŸ”¥ AMP
ğŸ”¥ and many more!


This program is especially great if you're:
â†ªï¸ Seeking advice on how to best start your career or land your dream job 
â†ªï¸ Wanting insights into future job prospects in tech
â†ªï¸ Looking to make meaningful industry connections and bonds
â†ªï¸ Needing feedback on personal projects


â—ï¸Students at all stages of their degree and from all degree backgrounds are invited to applyâ—ï¸


ğŸŒŸ  WHAT'S NEW? ğŸŒŸ
Weâ€™ve kept all the best bits of our 2019 program that you told us you loved, and redesigned the rest to make it bigger and better. Hereâ€™s whatâ€™s new this year:
  
âš¡ Improved allocations
Weâ€™re committed to giving you the best possible experience, starting with the most holistic allocation process! For successful applicants, weâ€™ll consider your preferred industry, company, group size, seniority levels and even hobbies!

âš¡3 personal and professional development events exclusive to mentees
This year, we will have 3 whole program events that aim to maximise networking time as well as opportunities to develop professional skills.

âš¡ Improved support 
This year, there will be more resources and more support than ever! In addition to being connected with a mentor, each mentee will be allocated a CSESoc representative as their first point of call throughout the program as well as ongoing resources to help you make the most out of the program!


This program is ideal for those who:
âœ… Have a strong interest in pursuing a career in technology (including engineering, trading and consulting)
âœ… Enjoy meeting new people and listening to othersâ€™ experiences
âœ… Want to take themselves out of their comfort zone
âœ… Enjoy taking initiative in and driving their own personal growth
âœ… Able to commit to regular, ~fortnightly catch ups with a mentor and engage in 3 exclusive whole program events/workshops


ğŸ“ APPLICATION PROCESS ğŸ“
1ï¸âƒ£  11:59pm Sunday 13/09: Applications due

âœ¨APPLY HERE: http://bit.ly/IndustryMentoringProgramApplications 

2ï¸âƒ£  Week 1 T3: You will receive a phone call if more information regarding your application is required 

3ï¸âƒ£  Week 1 Weekend T3: Successful applicants will be informed via email 

Applications will be evaluated on a ROLLING BASIS!
Please note that there are strictly âŒ NO EXTENSIONS âŒ on applications. 


ğŸ“†  ROUGH PROGRAM SCHEDULE ğŸ“†
The program is a 10 week commitment with the following key events:
1ï¸âƒ£  24th Sept (Week 2 T3): Kickoff event
2ï¸âƒ£  Week 5/6 T3: Mid-program event 
3ï¸âƒ£  Week 10/11 T3: Closing event


â“ FAQSâ“

ğŸ’¬ What are the commitments for this program? 
It is highly recommended that you be able to attend all 3 program events as well as a fortnightly meeting with your mentor.

ğŸ’¬ What are the expectations for a mentee? 
Mentees are expected to take ownership for their experience. More specifically, mentees should be prepared to drive conversations, reach out, followup, come prepared to meetings.

ğŸ’¬ Will this be online?
All whole program events will be deliver fully virtually. However, catch ups with your designated mentor can be of whatever form you are both comfortable with! We will make an effort to pair Sydney-based mentees with Sydney-based mentors, and non-Sydney-based mentees with non-Sydney-based mentors to maximise flexibility.
